description.narrative: The proposed interventions are informed by Oxfam's own assessments and ZIMVAC which forecast that 2,82 million people would need food aid due to the impacts of the El nino. The figure was revised to 4.1million for the January to March 2017 peak hunger period. The proposed project intends to support people affected by the El nino induced drought with food support , water provision and hygiene promotion , mainstream gender and protection and ensure that all these interventions meet the minimum standards. The activities will be implemented in Gutu , Masvingo, Matobo, Buhera and Gokwe South Districts by Oxfam and its Partners. A gender assessment forms part of project roll out in order for effective gender mainstreaming to happen as women are at the centre of all our humanitarian interventions. The targeted people will be the vulnerable affected by the El nino induced drought in the targeted Districts

mailing-address.narrative: Oxfam House, John Smith Drive, Oxford, OX4 2JY

sector.narrative: Right to Equity: Gender and Diversity

provider-org.narrative: UN United Nations Children's Fund UNICEF
